intro: Galium proliferum var. subnudum, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Asia and the Mediterranean. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender, branched stems that are often hairy. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and usually have a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
